intro: Dystaenia ibukiensis, commonly known as the Ibukiensis Dystaenia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Japan. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in mountainous areas with rich, loamy soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
